page.title: 11Stony Houghton
page.content: Stony Houghton is a hamlet. It has twelve cottages in it.There are three farms inside Stony Houghton.There are about one hundred and fifty trees,most of which have Dutch Elm disease.The nearest shop and nearest school are in New Houghton,about a mile away.There is a farm there which was an inn about a hundred years ago. There is an old Roman path which looked like a dirt track.In Stony Houghton there is only one main road,which,one afternoon,had a lot of traffic because of road works on the A617 road.There is a thousand acre farm nearby owned by the Duke of Devonshire,growing potatoes and cereals principally.In the hamlet there is only one telephone box.All the cottages were built from stone.
